bibl.title: Letter from Joseph H. McNinch to Philip Showalter Hench, May 1, 1956

div1.p: McNinch wants Hench to prepare a list of people whom Hench would like included in his proposal to the Senate.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph H. McNinch to Philip Showalter Hench, May 1, 1956
div1.opener:
DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
IN REPLY REFER TO:
MEDCM-SP 201 (Hench, Philip S) Civ
1 May 1956
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
General Love and Colonel Siler came to my office a few days ago
for the purpose of discussing your position on the Lambert bill.

We discussed your letter of 16 April to Senator Russell at some
length. Although the Departmental position on the Lambert bill
remains unchanged at present, both Major McKenzie, who has been the
Department of Defense action officer on the bill, and I are willing
to pursue further your counterproposal. To that end, we would
appreciate it if you could find time to prepare and forward to us a
list of the persons to whom your proposed bill would apply, together
with a short biographical sketch of each comparable to the informa-
tion that now appears on the Roll of Honor.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, J. H. McNinch JOSEPH H. McNINCH
Colonel, M. C.
Chief, Personnel Division
